1.premise: Outcome Measurement: Percentage of Participants With a Response Within 10 Days of First Dose of Denosumab. Response is defined as corrected serum calcium (CSC) ≤ 11.5 mg/dL within 10 days after the first dose of denosumab. For all CSC values, if albumin was ≤ 4 g/dL, the following formula was used to calculate CSC: CSC = Total serum calcium [mg/dL] + (0.8 × (4 - serum albumin [g/dL])). Time frame: 10 days. Results: Overall Number of Participants Analyzed: 33. Unit of Measure: percentage of participants: 63.6% (95% CI: 45.1 to 79.6).
1.statement: This outcome proves that Denosumab is effective despite no comparison group.

2.premise: Adverse Events 1: Total: 4/11 (36.36%). Blood bilirubin increased 1/11 (9.09%), Febrile neutropenia 1/11 (9.09%), Ejection fraction decreased 1/11 (9.09%), Supraventricular and nodal arrhythmia (Sinus tachycardia) 1/11 (9.09%), Sepsis 1/11 (9.09%), Lymphocyte count decreased 1/11 (9.09%), Neutrophil count decreased 1/11 (9.09%), Neutrophils/granulocytes (ANC/AGC) 1/11 (9.09%).
2.statement: Adverse event data provide information about how effective the treatment is.

3.premise: Outcome Measurement: Proportion of Patients With Blood Pressure <140/90 mmHg at Week 12. Blood pressure was measured at baseline and at week 12 after starting amlodipine. Time Frame: 12 weeks. Results: 70.2% of 47 patients had blood pressure <140/90 mmHg at week 12. 95% CI: 56.4 to 81.8.
3.statement: This outcome proves that Amlodipine is effective despite no comparison group.

4.premise: Outcome Measurement: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c <7% After 24 Weeks of Treatment With Sitagliptin. HbA1c levels were assessed at baseline and at the end of 24 weeks. Time Frame: 24 weeks. Results: 58.3% of 60 patients achieved HbA1c <7%. 95% CI: 44.9 to 70.9.
4.statement: This outcome proves that Sitagliptin is effective despite no comparison group.

5.premise: Adverse Events Summary: Total: 5/15 (33.33%). Elevated liver enzymes 2/15 (13.33%), Nausea 1/15 (6.67%), Thrombocytopenia 1/15 (6.67%), Bradycardia 1/15 (6.67%), Hypokalemia 1/15 (6.67%).
5.statement: Adverse event data provide information about how effective the treatment is.

6.premise: Adverse Events Summary: 6/20 (30.00%). Headache 3/20 (15.00%), Fatigue 2/20 (10.00%), Rash 1/20 (5.00%). All adverse events were Grade 1 or 2.
6.statement: Adverse event data provide information about how effective the drug is.

7.premise: Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events: 7/18 (38.89%). Anemia 2/18 (11.11%), Hypertension 2/18 (11.11%), Dizziness 1/18 (5.56%), Insomnia 1/18 (5.56%), Constipation 1/18 (5.56%).
7.statement: Adverse event data provide information about how effective the treatment is.

8.premise: Outcome: Proportion of patients achieving LDL cholesterol <100 mg/dL after 8 weeks of atorvastatin therapy. Results: 52.4% (11/21) of patients achieved the target. Time frame: 8 weeks.
8.statement: This outcome proves that Atorvastatin is effective despite no comparison group.

9.premise: Outcome: Rate of wound healing at Day 14 following topical application of silver sulfadiazine. 40% (8/20) of wounds showed full epithelialization by Day 14. Time frame: 14 days.
9.statement: This outcome proves that Silver sulfadiazine is effective despite no comparison group.

10.premise: Outcome: Percentage of participants with pain reduction ≥30% on a 10-point scale at Week 6 following treatment with oral tramadol. 65% (13/20) met the pain reduction threshold. No control group included.
10.statement: This outcome proves that Tramadol is effective despite no comparison group.
